attributes.comment:
The biggest concern for those of us who have family members trying to come
together as a family is the time involved in the immigration process. I believe that
there should be more effort made to speed up the process while still maintaining
security for our country. Some paperwork is redundant at best such as having to
fill out and submit an I-865 Affidavit of Support for a change of status case that
you had just filled out and submitted at an interview only weeks before.

Some cases are more earnest than others. If changing the fees will help speed
up the waiting period that would be great. When applying for a passport, one can
pay a higher fee to process the passport in just few days. If there were a graded
fee like that for the immigration process, that would allow those who are not in
great need to pay a lower fee and wait the longer period and allow those who need
to be together sooner (Such as families with children and or pregnant wives) to
pay the additional fee and have their paper work moved faster.

I personally would be willing to pay a much higher fee if it sped up the paperwork
and even decreased some of the redundancy.

Thank you

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Martin E. Gilmer
